t: Proverbs 1
The*p proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
To*p know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
To*p receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
To*p give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
A*p wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
To*p understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
The*p fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
My*p son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
For*p they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
My*p son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
If*p they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
Let*p us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
We*p shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
Cast*p in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
My*p son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
For*p their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
Surely*p in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
And*p they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
So*p are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
Wisdom*p crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
She*p crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
How*p long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
Turn*p you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
Because*p I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
But*p ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
I*p also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
When*p your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
Then*p shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
For*p that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:*s
They*p would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
Therefore*p shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
For*p the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
But*p whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
